description: Product of proper divisors of n.
comments: For n > 1: a(n) = A240694(n,A000005(n)-1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 10 2014
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: a(n) = A007955(n)/n = n^(A000005(n)/2-1) = sqrt(n^(number of factors of n other than 1 and n))a(n) = product{A027751(n,k): k=1..A000005(n)-1). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 04 2013
maple: A007956 := n -> mul(i,i=op(numtheory[divisors](n) minus {1,n}));seq(A007956(i), i=1..79); # - Peter Luschny, Mar 22 2011
mathematica: Table[Times@@Most[Divisors[n]], {n, 65}] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Apr 18 2011 *)a[n_] := n^(DivisorSigma[0, n]/2 - 1); Table[a[n], {n, 1, 65}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 07 2013 *)
prog: (PARI) A007956(n) = local(a);a=1;fordiv(n,d,a=a*d);a/n \\ _Michael B. Porter_, Dec 01 2009(PARI) a(n)=my(k); if(issquare(n, &k), k^(numdiv(n)-2), n^(numdiv(n)/2-1)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Oct 15 2015(Haskell)a007956 = product . a027751_row-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 04 2013, Nov 02 2011
author: R. Muller
